page.title: 01Parish Of Rock Area Worcs
page.content: THe early Norman Church of Rock dominates this area of intense agriculture and cherry orchards. The soil is mostly heavy clay, and the land is deeply fissured by the Gladder Brook, the Dick Brook and their tributaries. There are many small cottages and the fields are enclosed by hedgerows of hawthorn, holly and Oak trees. The network of narrow lanes is complex, with sharp corners and steep inclines. There are few large farms and many small holdings and market gardens. Barley, wheat and oats, sugar beet, cherries, plums apples and damsons and poultry of all kinds are the main products of the area as well as cattle sheep and pigs. Some of the inhabitants have ancestors going back two or three hundred years living in the same areas,if not the same farms, but most
